sources.data_found: Caltech has a first centrally managed high performance computing cluster supported by the Resnick Sustainability Institute.
General overview of resources available on the Resnick HPC. For specific details not listed, contact hpc@caltech.edu

student_data.notes: CS enrollment numbers estimated from: Total undergraduate enrollment of 987 (US News fall 2024) and graduate engineering enrollment of 546. Assuming CS represents ~15% of undergraduates (typical for tech-focused schools) = 150. Graduate CS (MS) estimated at ~22% of engineering graduate enrollment = 120. PhD CS estimated at ~15% of engineering graduate enrollment = 80. These are estimates as specific CS department enrollment data was not publicly available. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Caltech Resnick HPC Center exists but specific GPU inventory is not publicly documented. Contact hpc@caltech.edu for details. Unable to find public specifications for GPU nodes or counts.

analysis_notes: Limited public data available. Caltech Resnick HPC exists but does not publish detailed hardware specifications online. Student counts are estimated based on total enrollment figures as CS-specific data was not found.
